channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: More than 90,000 Jeep Grand Cherokees recalled over potential loss of drive power
item.description: Vehicles impacted by the recall include 2022 to 2026 plug-in hybrid electric models of the Jeep Grand Cherokee.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz wins his 2nd U.S. Open at match delayed by Trump's attendance
item.description: The president's arrival delayed the match and left many ticketholders waiting in line. He watched from Rolex's luxury box.

item.title: Trump walks back Chicago 'war' threat, but vows to 'clean up' cities

item.title: Postal traffic to US drops more than 80% after trade exemption rule ends, UN agency says
item.description: The de minimis rule that allowed small packages worth less than $800 to be exempt from tariffs ended on Friday, Aug. 29, 2025.

item.title: Colombia's lone Amazon port faces drying river and rising tensions with Peru
item.description: Colombia's only Amazon port town could soon be cut off from the river that keeps it alive. As drought and a shifting river spark a tense border disput...

item.title: Koah raises $5M to bring ads into AI apps
item.description: One investor says Koah is "building the essential monetization layer for consumer AI."

item.title: Are bad incentives to blame for AI hallucinations?
item.description: How can a chatbot be so wrong — and sound so confident in its wrongness?

item.title: Florida’s plan to drop school vaccine rule won’t start for 90 days, won’t cover all diseases
Black man shot at while waiting to go to work says South Carolina needs hate crime law
Microsoft says Azure affected after cables cut in the Red Sea
item.description: It's not clear who cut the cables or why.

item.title: Hyundai’s eVTOL startup Supernal pauses work following CEO and CTO departures
item.description: The shakeup comes as the startup was still struggling to get its test vehicle off the ground -- literally. The first flight was only in March.
